verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD said unto me, Take thee a great roll, and write in it with a man’s pen concerning Mahershalalhashbaz.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Get a large scroll and write on it in ordinary script: Maher-shalal-hash-baz."

verses.kjv: And I took unto me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.
verses.ct: So I brought in reliable witnesses to verify the record — Uriah the priest and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah.

verses.kjv: And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived, and bare a son. Then said the LORD to me, Call his name Mahershalalhashbaz.
verses.ct: Then I had relations with the prophetess, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. The LORD told me, "Name him Maher-shalal-hash-baz."

verses.kjv: For before the child shall have knowledge to cry, My father, and my mother, the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be taken away before the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: Because before the boy even knows how to say 'Daddy' or 'Mommy,' the wealth of Damascus and the plunder of Samaria will be carried off by the king of Assyria."

verses.kjv: The LORD spake also unto me again, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to me again:

verses.kjv: Forasmuch as this people refuseth the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah’s son;
verses.ct: "Because this people has rejected the gently flowing waters of Shiloah and instead takes delight in Rezin and Remaliah's son,

verses.kjv: Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria, and all his glory: and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks:
verses.ct: therefore pay attention — the Lord is about to bring against them the mighty floodwaters of the Euphrates River, meaning the king of Assyria in all his power. It will rise over all its channels and overflow all its banks.

verses.kjv: And he shall pass through Judah; he shall overflow and go over, he shall reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.
verses.ct: It will sweep into Judah, flooding and surging until it reaches up to the neck. Its spreading waters will cover the entire width of your land, Immanuel."

verses.kjv: Associate yourselves, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear, all ye of far countries: gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.
verses.ct: Band together, you nations, but you will be shattered! Listen, all you distant lands: prepare yourselves for war, but you will be shattered! Prepare yourselves, but you will be shattered!

verses.kjv: Take counsel together, and it shall come to nought; speak the word, and it shall not stand: for God is with us.
verses.ct: Devise your strategies, but they will fail. Make your declarations, but they will not succeed — because God is with us.

verses.kjv: For the LORD spake thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to me with an overpowering grip and warned me not to follow the path of this people. He said:

verses.kjv: Say ye not, A confederacy, to all them to whom this people shall say, A confederacy; neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid.
verses.ct: "Don't call everything a conspiracy just because this people calls it a conspiracy. Don't share their fears, and don't be terrified by what terrifies them.

verses.kjv: Sanctify the LORD of hosts himself; and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.
verses.ct: The LORD of Hosts — he is the one you must regard as holy. Let him be the one you deeply revere; let him be the one who fills you with awe.

verses.kjv: And he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock of offence to both the houses of Israel, for a gin and for a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He will be a sanctuary for those who trust him, but a stone that causes stumbling and a rock that trips up both houses of Israel — a trap and a snare for the people living in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And many among them shall stumble, and fall, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.
verses.ct: Many of them will stumble and fall, be broken, be caught in the trap, and be captured."

verses.kjv: Bind up the testimony, seal the law among my disciples.
verses.ct: Seal up this testimony; secure the instruction among my disciples.

verses.kjv: And I will wait upon the LORD, that hideth his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.
verses.ct: I will wait for the LORD, who has withdrawn his favor from the house of Jacob, and I will put my hope in him.

verses.kjv: Behold, I and the children whom the LORD hath given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from the LORD of hosts, which dwelleth in mount Zion.
verses.ct: Look — I and the children the LORD has given me serve as signs and symbols in Israel from the LORD of Hosts, who dwells on Mount Zion.

verses.kjv: And when they shall say unto you, Seek unto them that have familiar spirits, and unto wizards that peep, and that mutter: should not a people seek unto their God? for the living to the dead?
verses.ct: When people tell you, "Go consult the mediums and spiritists who whisper and mutter," you should respond: "Shouldn't a people consult their God? Why would the living seek answers from the dead?"

verses.kjv: To the law and to the testimony: if they speak not according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.
verses.ct: Turn to God's instruction and his testimony! If anyone does not speak in agreement with this word, it is because they have no light in them.

verses.kjv: And they shall pass through it, hardly bestead and hungry: and it shall come to pass, that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse their king and their God, and look upward.
verses.ct: They will wander through the land, distressed and starving. When hunger overtakes them, they will become furious and curse their king and their God. They will look up toward the heavens,

verses.kjv: And they shall look unto the earth; and behold trouble and darkness, dimness of anguish; and they shall be driven to darkness.
verses.ct: then look down at the earth, and everywhere they turn there will be trouble and darkness, the gloom of anguish — and they will be thrust into total darkness.
